Title: Show linear independence of a set of vectors close to an orthonormal basis
Content:
This is a question from Linear Algebra Done Right . Suppose $e_1, \dots, e_n$ is an orthonormal basis of $V$ and $v_1, \dots, v_n$ are vectors in $V$ such that
$$ \| e_j - v_j \| < \frac{1} {\sqrt{n}} $$
for each $j$. Prove that $v_1, \dots, v_n$ is a basis of $V$.
I tried to show this if $V$ is a two dimensional space by contradiction. However, it seems too messy to use the same idea for a general case. Does anyone have hints for this problem?
